sentences: Anuradha Paudwal (born 27 October 1954) is an Indian playback singer who works predominantly in Bollywood.
She has a long music career spanning over 4 decades.
She was awarded the Padma Shri, India's fourth-highest civilian award, by the Government of India in 2017.
She is ranked NO. 31 in Youtube's Music Charts and Insights list of top global artist as of 3 February 2022.
She has been on chart since last 237 weeks.
Anuradha made her debut from a Sanskrit verse in the 1973 Hindi film Abhiman, composed by S. D. Burman.
She was born as Alka Nadakarni, in a Marathi speaking family in Karwar.
1991: Best Female Playback Singer – "Nazar Ke Saamne" (Aashiqui)
1991: Best Female Playback Singer – "Mujhe Neend Na Aaye" (Dil)
